newsitem.title: USA: Ex-Stratton Oakmont salesman barred for five years.
newsitem.headline: Ex-Stratton Oakmont salesman barred for five years.

text.p: Regulators on Wednesday issued an order barring for five years a former Stratton Oakmont Inc salesman for allegedly using high pressure and fraudulent sales tactics "in utter disregard of his obligations to customers."
The order signed by SEC Chairman Arthur Levitt and three other SEC commissioners upheld a ruling by an administrative law judge against Richard Puccio, of Syossett, N.Y.
The SEC said Pucio engaged in "boiler room" sales practices and failed to tell customers the house stocks he was selling were speculative and risky.
The order bars Puccio from joining any broker or dealer, with a right to reapply after five years.
The SEC said Puccio's admissions at a hearing show he engaged "in knowing misconduct."
He could not be reached for comment.
The SEC alleged Puccio made baseless price predictions, discouraged customers from selling, misrepresented Stratton's research capabilities and impersonated other salesmen.
He was fined $500 and promised not to repeat the violation.
